message.content:
En exploitant l’analyse approfondie de #codebase, je prescris une révision complète de #file:README.template.md : restructurer la table des matières en sections hiérarchiques et navigables, rédiger des instructions d’installation pas-à-pas testées sur les environnements cibles, illustrer chaque commande avec des snippets exécutables et des cas d’usage réels, harmoniser le vocabulaire technique avec le glossaire officiel du projet, appliquer un style Markdown cohérent (titres, listes, blocs de code, badges), et valider la conformité aux standards de documentation via un linter automatisé avant commit.\
Utilises tes  agenis  ts

# {{WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION}}

[![Governance](control-plane/reports/governance/governance-badge.svg)](control-plane/governance/decisions.log.jsonl) [![Covenant](control-plane/reports/governance/covenant-badge.svg)](control-plane/governance/copilot-covenant.mdx)

## Greeting {{AGENT_NAME}}

Welcome to {{WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION}}!

You are your user's {{AGENT_PROFILE_PREFIX}} {{AGENT_PROFILE_TYPE}}: Our Guide to Agentic AI

## See Also

- **[E2E Agentic Demo](docs/user-guide/workflows/agentic-e2e-demo.md)** - Live planner→tester collaboration example
- **[Project Brief](docs/user-guide/PROJECT_BRIEF.md)** - Comprehensive overview of agentic systems
- **[Best Practices](docs/user-guide/best-practices.md)** - Guidelines for agentic development
- **[User Guide](docs/user-guide/index.md)** - Start-to-finish usage docs
- **[Getting Started](docs/user-guide/getting-started.md)** - Quick setup and first run
- **[Developer Guide](docs/developer/index.md)** - API, commands, and contribution docs

## License

This project is licensed under the {{WORKSPACE_LICENSE}} License - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE.md) file for details.

{
  "name": "agentic-workspace",
  "private": true,
  "version": "0.2.0",
  "type": "module",
  "description": "Helper scripts for rendering README from .env",
  "workspaces": [
    "packages/*"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "render:readme": "node scripts/render-readme.js",
    "render:license": "node packages/tools/bin/render-license.js",
    "render:roadmap": "node packages/tools/bin/generate-roadmap.js",
    "generate:devcontainer": "node scripts/generate-devcontainer.js",
    "docs": "typedoc",
    "narrate": "node scripts/generate-quickstart.js",
    "graph": "node scripts/build-typed-graph.js",
    "validate:deep-dive": "uv run --frozen python scripts/validate-deep-dive.py",
    "test": "vitest run",
    "test:watch": "vitest",
    "subagent:smoke": "node scripts/subagent-smoke.js",
    "deploy": "node scripts/deploy.js",
    "fix": "node scripts/fix.js",
    "init:package": "node scripts/init-package.js",
    "bootstrap:context7": "node scripts/bootstrap-context7.js",
    "demo:cross-verify": "node scripts/cross-verify-demo.js",
    "demo:cross-verify:convex": "AGENTIC_DB=convex CONVEX_URL=${CONVEX_URL:-http://127.0.0.1:3210} node scripts/cross-verify-demo.js",
    "new-report": "node scripts/reports/new-report.js",
    "inventory:scan": "node scripts/inventory/scan.js",
    "format:check": "prettier -c .",
    "check:lock": "node scripts/maintenance/check-lock.js",
    "check:meta": "node scripts/maintenance/check-meta.js",
    "review": "npm run check:lock && npm run check:meta && npm run lint && npm test && npm run covenants:generate && npm run covenants:verify && npm run format:check && npm run claude:validate && npm run gov:badge && npm run covenant:badge && npm run render:readme && npm run narrate && npm run graph",
    "lint": "eslint . --max-warnings=0",
    "lint:fix": "eslint . --fix || true",
    "lint:focus:imports": "eslint apps/dashboard/server.js extensions/decision-codelens/src/extension.ts packages/tools/bin/generate-roadmap.js packages/tools/bin/render-license.js --fix || true",
    "format": "prettier -w .",
    "prepare": "husky",
    "changelog": "conventional-changelog -p conventionalcommits -i CHANGELOG.md -s",
    "pacte:print": "node scripts/pacte/print.js",
    "gov:check": "tsx control-plane/scripts/governance/check.ts",
    "gov:hash-chain": "tsx scripts/governance/hash-chain.ts",
    "gov:classify-scan": "tsx control-plane/scripts/governance/classify-scan.ts",
    "gov:sync-decisions": "tsx scripts/governance/sync-decisions.ts",
    "gov:validate-ids": "tsx scripts/governance/validate-ids.ts",
    "gov:badge": "node scripts/governance/generate-badge.js",
    "covenant:badge": "node scripts/governance/generate-covenant-badge.js",
    "covenants:generate": "node scripts/governance/generate-covenants.mjs",
    "covenants:verify": "node scripts/governance/verify-covenants.mjs",
    "review:fast": "eslint . --quiet --cache && vitest run --reporter=dot",
    "review:strict": "eslint . --max-warnings=0 && vitest run --reporter=dot && npm run covenants:generate && npm run covenants:verify && npm run covenant:badge",
    "ai:guard": "node scripts/ai/guard-diff.js",
    "scan:licenses": "node scripts/ai/license-scan.js",
    "claude:validate": "node .claude/scripts/simple-validate.js",
    "claude:migrate": "node .claude/scripts/migrate-claude-components.js",
    "claude:generate:command": "node .claude/scripts/generate-command.js",
    "claude:generate:agent": "node .claude/scripts/generate-agent.js",
    "claude:generate:workflow": "node .claude/scripts/generate-workflow.js",
    "ext:build": "echo '(placeholder build, bundle via esbuild if needed)'",
    "ext:package": "vsce package --no-dependencies -o dist/decision-codelens.vsix",
    "ext:publish": "vsce publish"
  },
  "vitest": {
    "resolve": {
      "alias": {
        "vscode": "./tests/__mocks__/vscode.ts"
      }
    }
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@commitlint/cli": "^19.4.0",
    "@commitlint/config-conventional": "^19.4.0",
    "@eslint/js": "^9.32.0",
    "@octokit/rest": "^21.0.2",
    "@types/vscode": "^1.90.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^8.0.0",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^8.0.0",
    "conventional-changelog-cli": "^5.0.0",
    "convex": "^1.14.1",
    "dotenv": "^16.4.5",
    "eslint": "^9.9.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^9.1.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.29.1",
    "eslint-plugin-n": "^17.10.3",
    "eslint-plugin-promise": "^6.4.0",
    "fast-check": "^3.17.1",
    "globals": "^16.3.0",
    "husky": "^9.1.4",
    "lint-staged": "^15.2.9",
    "prettier": "^3.3.3",
    "tsx": "^4.7.0",
    "typedoc": "^0.25.13",
    "typescript": "^5.4.5",
    "vitest": "^3.2.4",
    "vsce": "^1.97.0"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@vscode/vsce": "^3.6.0"
  }
}

# `.env` Environment Variables

## Path to the workspace folder
WORKSPACE_FOLDER=f:/systems/ai/agentic

## Name of the workspace
WORKSPACE_NAME=agentic

## Description of the workspace
WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION=The World of AI Agentic Systems   

## License of the workspace
WORKSPACE_LICENSE=MIT

## Agent Card

### Name of the agent used in docs and greetings
AGENT_NAME=Claude Code


## Agent Profile

AGENT_PROFILE_PREFIX=Emergent
AGENT_PROFILE_TYPE=Collaborator
AGENT_PROFILE_SUBTYPE=Emergent

## Maintainer
OWNER_NAME=Omar El Mountassir
OWNER_EMAIL=omar.mountassir@gmail.com

## GitHub Integration
GITHUB_REPOSITORY=omar.el.mountassir/agentic
GITHUB_OWNER=omar.el.mountassir
GITHUB_EMAIL=omar.mountassir@gmail.com
GITHUB_REPO=agentic

## Runtime Versions
NODE_VERSION=20
PYTHON_VERSION=3.11
DEVCONTAINER_NAME={{WORKSPACE_NAME}}-devcontainer

file.content:
# Getting Started

Get the workspace running in minutes and validate everything end-to-end.

## Prerequisites

- Node.js 18+
- Git
- Optional (for JSON validation): Python via uv

## 1) Install dependencies

Use npm ci for a clean, reproducible install.

```bash
npm ci
```

## 2) Render README and run the review pipeline

The review pipeline runs lint, tests, formatting checks, and generators (README, QUICKSTART, graph).

```bash
# Render README (uses .env or .env.local)
npm run render:readme

# Full quality gates (lint, tests, format check, docs, graph)
npm run review
```

Expected highlights:

- Lint: PASS
- Tests: PASS (10/10)
- Format: PASS
- README rendered from README.template.md
- docs/QUICKSTART.md and docs/graph.json generated

## 3) Create a new package (scaffold)

Use the packaged scaffold to add a library quickly.

```bash
# Create a package named demo-package
npm run init:package -- demo-package
```

What you’ll get under packages/demo-package:

- package.json (workspace-local, private)
- tsconfig.json (extends repository defaults)
- src/index.ts (hello example)
- tests/ (empty folder to start your tests)

Re-run the pipeline any time:

```bash
npm run review
```

## 4) Make a small change and validate

Try a tiny edit in your new package and see the gates catch problems early.

Example: add a quick unit test in packages/demo-package/tests/hello.test.ts and run:

```bash
npm test
```

Then ensure formatting and overall quality remain green:

```bash
npm run review
```

## Next Steps

- Explore the Planner → Tester workflow: see Workflows → Agentic E2E Demo
- Use slash commands: /review, /deploy, /fix (Tasks available in .vscode)
- Dive into the Developer Guide for APIs and contribution guidelines
- Optional persistence: see Developer Guide → Integrations → Convex to run the demo against Convex

Table of Contents - [Quick Start](#quick-start) - [Prerequisites](#prerequisites) - [Installation](#installation) - [Usage Examples](#usage-examples) - [Architecture Overview](#architecture-overview) - [Development](#development) - [Testing](#testing) - [Documentation](#documentation) - [Contributing](#contributing) - [License](#license) ## Quick Start Get the workspace running in minutes and validate everything end-to-end. ### Prerequisites | Requirement | Version | Description | |-------------|---------|-------------| | **Node.js** | {{NODE_VERSION}}+ | JavaScript runtime environment | | **Git** | Latest | Version control system | | **Python** | {{PYTHON_VERSION}}+ | Optional: for JSON validation via `uv` | ### Installation 1. **Clone the repository** ```bash git clone https://github.com/{{GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}.git cd {{WORKSPACE_NAME}} ``` 2. **Install dependencies** ```bash # Clean, reproducible install npm ci ``` 3. **Render README and validate setup** ```bash # Generate README from template using .env values npm run render:readme # Run full quality gates (lint, tests, format check, docs, graph) npm run review ``` **Expected output:** ``` ✅ Lint: PASS (0 warnings) ✅ Tests: PASS (10/10) ✅ Format: PASS ✅ README rendered from README.template.md ✅ docs/QUICKSTART.md and docs/graph.json generated ``` ## Usage Examples ### Creating a New Package ```bash # Scaffold a new package with workspace configuration npm run init:package -- demo-package ``` **Generated structure:** ``` packages/demo-package/ ├── package.json # workspace-local, private ├── tsconfig.json # extends repository defaults ├── src/index.ts # hello example └── tests/ # empty folder to start your tests ``` ### Running Quality Gates ```bash # Quick diagnostic check (quiet, cached) npm run review:fast # Full authoritative review npm run review:strict # Individual commands npm run lint # ESLint with zero warnings npm test # Vitest test runner npm run format:check # Prettier formatting ``` ### Development Workflow ```bash # Start development mode npm run test:watch # Watch mode for tests # Make changes, then validate npm run lint:fix # Auto-fix linting issues npm run format # Auto-format code npm run review # Full validation pipeline ``` ## Architecture Overview {{WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION}} follows **Clean Architecture** principles with hexagonal boundaries: ```mermaid graph TB UI[Interface Adapters] --> APP[Application Services] APP --> DOM[Domain Layer] UI --> |"✅ Allowed"| APP APP --> |"✅ Allowed"| DOM DOM --> |"❌ Forbidden"| APP APP --> |"❌ Forbidden"| UI ``` ### Package Layering Rules | Layer | Dependencies | Exports | |-------|-------------|---------| | **packages/app** | ✅ application/domain services
❌ database adapters | Next.js application | | **packages/database** | ✅ repository ports only | Hidden implementation | | **tools/scripts** | ✅ read-only domain types
❌ runtime frameworks | Utilities | ### Performance Budgets - **Web bundle**: <200KB gzipped - **Server requests**: <150ms P95 locally - **Complexity hotspots**: ≤15 per module ## Development ### Environment Setup 1. **Copy environment template** ```bash cp .env.example .env ``` 2. **Configure workspace variables** ```bash # Edit .env with your values WORKSPACE_DESCRIPTION="Your Agentic Workspace" AGENT_NAME="Your AI Assistant" GITHUB_REPOSITORY="your-username/your-repo" ``` 3. **Optional: DevContainer setup** ```bash npm run generate:devcontainer ``` ### Available Scripts | Command | Description | Usage | |---------|-------------|-------| | `npm run render:readme` | Generate README from template | Development | | `npm run review` | Full quality pipeline | Pre-commit | | `npm run review:fast` | Quick diagnostic check | Development | | `npm run review:strict` | Authoritative validation | CI/CD | | `npm run lint` | ESLint with zero warnings | Validation | | `npm run test` | Run all tests | Validation | | `npm run format` | Format code with Prettier | Development | | `npm run covenants:generate` | Update governance covenants | Maintenance | ### Governance Commands ```bash # Decision logging and governance npm run gov:sync-decisions # Sync decision logs npm run gov:badge # Update governance badge npm run covenant:badge # Update covenant badge npm run gov:classify-scan # Privacy classification scan ``` ## Testing ### Running Tests ```bash # Run all tests npm test # Watch mode during development npm run test:watch # Specific test patterns npm test -- --grep "integration" npm test -- packages/demo-package ``` ### Test Structure ``` tests/ ├── __mocks__/ # Mock implementations ├── *.test.js # Unit tests ├── *.spec.ts # TypeScript tests └── integration/ # Integration tests ``` ### Quality Gates All commits must pass: - ✅ **Linting**: `eslint . --max-warnings=0` - ✅ **Tests**: All test suites pass - ✅ **Formatting**: `prettier --check .` - ✅ **Covenants**: Governance rules verified - ✅ **Type checking**: TypeScript compilation - ✅ **Classification**: Privacy scan stable ## Documentation ### Structure | Section | Purpose | Audience | |---------|---------|----------| | **[User Guide](docs/user-guide/index.md)** | Getting started, workflows | End users | | **[Developer Guide](docs/developer/index.md)** | API, contribution guidelines | Contributors | | **[Architecture](docs/developer/stacks/technical/tech-stack.md)** | System design, principles | Architects | | **[Governance](docs/governance/)** | Decision logs, compliance | Maintainers | ### Key Documents - **[Getting Started](docs/user-guide/getting-started.md)** - Quick setup and first run - **[E2E Agentic Demo](docs/user-guide/workflows/agentic-e2e-demo.md)** - Live planner→tester collaboration example - **[Project Brief](docs/user-guide/PROJECT_BRIEF.md)** - Comprehensive overview of agentic systems - **[Best Practices](docs/user-guide/best-practices.md)** - Guidelines for agentic development - **[API Reference](docs/developer/api-reference.md)** - Complete API documentation ### Auto-Generated Documentation ```bash # Generate TypeDoc documentation npm run docs # Generate project roadmap npm run render:roadmap # Generate quickstart guide npm run narrate ``` ## Contributing ### Workflow 1. **Fork and clone the repository** 2. **Create a feature branch**: `git checkout -b feature/amazing-feature` 3. **Make changes and validate**: `npm run review` 4. **Commit with conventional format**: `git commit -m "feat: add amazing feature"` 5. **Push and create Pull Request** ### Code Standards - **Zero warnings policy**: All linting warnings must be resolved - **Test-first development**: Write tests before implementation - **Clean Architecture**: Follow layer boundaries - **Conventional commits**: Use semantic commit messages - **Documentation**: Update docs for new features ### Review Process Pull requests must pass: - ✅ Automated CI checks - ✅ Code review approval - ✅ Documentation updates - ✅ Breaking change documentation ## License This project is licensed under the **{{WORKSPACE_LICENSE}} License** - see the [LICENSE](LICENSE.md) file for details. --- **Maintainer**: {{OWNER_NAME}} ({{OWNER_EMAIL}}) **Repository**: [{{GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}](https://github.com/{{GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}) **Issues**: [Report bugs and feature requests](https://github.com/{{GITHUB_REPOSITORY}}/issues)
